questions.question: Which of the following is correct?

answers.a: Channel state information (CSI) at the transmitter is necessary for this scheme to be effective
answers.b: Choosing a larger number of sub-carriers will lead to more accurate (less errors) communication
answers.c: If too many sub-carriers are used, it might lead to inter-carrier interference (ICI)
answers.d: Cyclic prefix is mandatory even if this scheme is implemented in continuous time

explanations.a: Incorrect. CSI at the transmitter is helpful but not strictly necessary for OFDM's effectiveness.
explanations.b: Incorrect. A larger number of sub-carriers reduces ICI only up to a point; too many can increase it due to synchronization issues.
explanations.c: Correct. Excessive sub-carriers can cause tight spacing, leading to inter-carrier interference (ICI).
explanations.d: Incorrect. Cyclic prefix is specific to discrete-time implementations for handling circular convolution.

questions.question: What does 'orthogonal' refer to in OFDM?

answers.a: The sub-carriers are all orthogonal to each other, which can mitigate inter-carrier interference (ICI)
answers.b: The basis signals used to perform QAM encoding are orthogonal

explanations.a: Correct. Orthogonality among sub-carriers ensures they don't interfere with each other in the frequency domain.
explanations.b: Incorrect. QAM encoding does not rely on orthogonal basis signals in this context.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Only sub-carriers are orthogonal, not QAM basis signals.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Sub-carrier orthogonality is fundamental to OFDM.
